intro: Kyllinga tanzaniae, commonly known as Tanzanian spikerush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Tanzania and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, clustered spikes of flowers, typically in shades of green or brown. Kyllinga tanzaniae thrives in wetland environments and is adapted to moist, nutrient-rich soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
